FirstAnnual Forum of the BusinessAlliance for Food Fortification
Public-Private Partnership Launched to Improve Nutrition in Developing Countries
Leading representatives of the global food industry, civil society, government and academic experts, gathered in Beijing, China,on 22­23 October 2005,launched the BusinessAlliance for Food Fortification and discussed actions to reduce the devastating effects of vitamin and mineral deficiencies and improve the health of the world's poorest peoples.
he Global Alliance for Improved Nutrition · BAFF was formally launched as a private sec- (GAIN) and World Bank Institute (WBI) tor-led initiative facilitated by GAIN and brought together 150 decision makers for WBI. The launch was the culmination of a the First Annual Forum of the Business Alliance process begun with a preliminary roundtable for Food Fortification (BAFF) in Beijing, China, discussion of private sector roles in fighting 22­23 October 2005. World Bank Institute Hebei Provincial CDC World Food Programme Hoganas AB Zheng Zhou Sanquan Foods, Co., Ltd Hoganas China Co., Ltd  THE BUSINESS ALLIANCE FOR FOOD FORTIFICATION - BAFF GLOBAL LAUNCH
Beijing, China ­ 22 October 2005
Audience: Selected International Private Sector Representatives
Objectives: Confirm Companies' Commitment to the BAFF Initiative Review Current Fortification Successes of BAFF Companies
1:30 ­ 2:00 REGISTRATION
2:00 ­ 2:30 INTRODUCTION Mr. Robert Davies, CEO Participants Introductions International Business Leaders Forum Meeting Objectives
2:30 ­ 3:00 THE BAFF FRAMEWORK A key mechanism for the GAIN Alliance. Mr. Marc Van Ameringen Interim Executive Director Global Alliance for Improved Nutrition The contribution of the World Bank Institute. Dr. Djordjija Petkoski Head of Private Sector Development World Bank Institute
3:00 ­ 4:00 INDIVIDUAL ACTION Current Fortification Projects of the BAFF Companies: Mr. Robert Davies Success Stories and Lessons Learned
Topics: Informal Input from Business Leaders How to improve existing projects? What are the principal barriers for doing more? What is the value added by partnership?
4:00 ­ 4:30 Coffee Break
4:30 ­ 6:00 COLLECTIVE ACTION Proposed areas for collaboration:
Sector Initiatives: Flour, Oil, Premix, Rice Dr. Glen Maberly Flour Fortification Initiative Example
Corporate Support for the 10-Year Vitamin and Mineral Mr. Rainer Gross, Chief of Nutrition Deficiencies Strategic Plan UNICEF
The BAFF declaration Ms Harriet Weiss, Strategy XXI
Other Suggestions from the Group
Discussion
6:00 ­ 6:30 NEXT STEPS Decisions and Conclusions Mr. Robert Davies
6:30 ­ 9:30 OFFICIAL BAFF LAUNCH Mr. Jay Naidoo, Chairman of the Board Cocktail Reception and Dinner Global Alliance for Improved Nutrition
GAIN Global Alliance for Improved Nutrition Av. Giuseppe-Motta 52 Case postale 55 1211 Genève 20 T +41 22 749 18 50 F +41 22 749 18 51 www.gainhealth.org  THE BUSINESS ALLIANCE FOR FOOD FORTIFICATION ­ BAFF First Annual Forum: THE BUSINESS CASE FOR FOOD FORTIFICATION
Beijing, China - 23 October 2005
Audience: International and Chinese Private Sector, Chinese Government, Multilateral Agencies, Donor Agencies, Civil Society, Media, Academics, GAIN Board
Objectives: Discuss the Business Case for Food Fortification Identify Creative Solutions to Address the Cost of Fortification Recommend Approaches to Scale Up Food Fortification in China
8:30 ­ 9:00 REGISTRATION
9:00 ­ 10:00 OPENING REMARKS The Chinese Government's Agenda on Food Fortification Dr. Longde Wang, China Vice Health Minister Mr. Li Shenglin, Deputy Director, NDRC
The Global Vision of Food Fortification Mr. Jay Naidoo, Chairman of the Board Global Alliance for Improved Nutrition
Objectives of the First BAFF Annual Forum Mr. Robert Davies, CEO International Business Leaders Forum
10:00 ­ 11:00 PLENARY SESSION: Setting the Scene for the BAFF Food Fortification, the Second Best Development Bet: Dr. Harold Alderman An analysis by economists of the Copenhagen Lead Human Development Economist Consensus World Bank
Panel Presentations and Discussion:
Food Market Complexity and Food Industry Responsibility: Dr. Michael Heasman, City University London Impact on the fortification agenda Co-Author of Food Wars:The Global Battle for Mouths, Minds and Markets
Corporate Social Responsibility in the Food Industry: Ms. Aileen Ionescu-Somers Can fortification become a CSR strategy? Forum, Corporate Sustainability Management Institute for Management and Development, IMD
11:00 - 11:15 BRIEFING: Three Breakout Roundtables In preliminary consultations, companies identified the cost Moderators and Mr. Robert Davies of fortification as a major obstacle. What are the strategies to manage the cost? 1. How to Finance Fortification Strategies? 2. How to Integrate the Cost of Fortification Through the Supply Chain? 3. Is the Cost of Fortification a Policy Issue?
11:15 - 11:30 Coffee Break
11:30 - 12:30 ROUNDTABLES: Parallel Discussions Sustainable Financing Strategies: Incentives on taxes and Moderator: Mr. Admassu Tadesse tariffs, subsidies, growing new markets, working with vol- Corporate Strategy umes, and grants Development Bank of Southern Africa
Sustainable Business Models: Analysis of effective fortifica- Moderator: Dr. Djordjija Petkoski tion strategies through the supply chain ­ what can be Head of Private Sector Development learned? World Bank Institute
Sustainable Policies: Analysis of the level playing field in- Moderator: Dr. M.G. Venkatesh Mannar cluding regulation, quality control, consumer participation. Executive Director, Micronutrient Initiative
The Chinese Perspective: The three subjects will be dis- cussed by non-English speaking Chinese invitees Moderator: Dr. Chen Junshi, CDC China  12:30 - 2:00 LUNCH
2:00 - 2:30 PLENARY SESSION: Breakout Roundtable Reports Two Key Recommendations and Two Action Points per Moderators and Mr. Robert Davies group
2:30 ­ 3:30 PLENARY SESSION: Current Vitamin and Mineral Defi- ciencies Situation in China: A public health perspective Madame Chen Chunming, CDC-GAIN Board
Panel Presentations and Discussion: Three Chinese business cases Salt Fortification (TBC) Chinese Salt Company (TBC)
Soya Sauce Fortification Zhang Lin, CEO of Shijiazhuang Zhenji Brew Group Co.
Flour Fortification Mr. Zhou Baozhong, Chairman of the Board of Directors, Qingdao Biomate Food Stuff Co.
3:30 ­ 3:45 BRIEFING: Three Breakout Roundtables The three groups will develop actions points focusing on Mr. Robert Davies future food fortification initiatives in China.
3:45 ­ 4:15 Coffee Break
4:15 ­ 5:15 ROUNDTABLES: Parallel Discussions
How to Accelerate and Scale Up Current Fortification Moderator: Professor Yu Xiaodong, Projects in China? PNDC and Chinese Participants
How to Accelerate and Scale Up Current Fortification Moderator Ms. Harriet Weiss, Strategy XXI Projects in China? with International Companies
The 10-Year Vitamin and Mineral Deficiencies Strategic Moderator Mr. Rainer Gross, Plan: What approach for China? Chief of Nutrition, UNICEF with Development Agencies
5:15 ­ 6:00 PLENARY SESSION: Breakout Roundtable Reports Two Key Recommendations and Two Action Points per Moderators and Mr. Robert Davies group
6:00 ­ 6:30 CONCLUSIONS and NEXT STEPS Mr. Robert Davies Mr. Marc Van Ameringen Interim Executive Director, GAIN Dr. Djordjija Petkoski Madame Chen Chunming, CDC-GAIN Board
7:00 ­ 10:00 INAUGURAL DINNER
GAIN Global Alliance for Improved Nutrition Av. Giuseppe-Motta 52 Case postale 55 1211 Genève 20 T +41 22 749 18 50 F +41 22 74918 51 www.gainhealth.org
